title: IPC Section 299 - Culpable Homicide
text: Culpable homicide: causing death by doing an act with the intention of causing death or with knowledge that the act is likely to cause death.

title: IPC Section 300 - Murder
text: Murder: culpable homicide with certain specified exceptions; punishable with death or life imprisonment in many cases.

title: IPC Section 302 - Punishment for Murder
text: Punishment: Death or life imprisonment for murder; court discretion for other punishments and fines.

title: IPC Section 304A - Causing Death by Negligence
text: Punishment for causing death by rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide; simple imprisonment or fine.

title: IPC Section 307 - Attempt to Murder
text: Attempt to commit murder; punishments vary and can be extended depending on injury caused and intent.

title: IPC Section 420 - Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property
text: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property — punishment includes imprisonment and fine.

title: IPC Section 375 - Rape (Definition)
text: Definition of rape (outline of acts that constitute rape); legal elements include absence of consent, certain relationships, and circumstances.

title: IPC Section 376 - Punishment for Rape
text: Punishment for rape; degrees of severity and enhanced penalties for aggravated forms.

title: IPC Section 498A - Cruelty to Woman by Husband or Relatives
text: Cruelty includes domestic violence, mental or physical cruelty related to dowry demand; criminal offense.

title: IPC Section 499 - Defamation (Definition)
text: Defamation: making or publishing false statements harming reputation; exceptions for truth or public good.

title: IPC Section 500 - Punishment for Defamation
text: Punishment: simple imprisonment, fine, or both for criminal defamation.

title: IPC Section 323 - Voluntarily Causing Hurt
text: Voluntarily causing hurt; punishable with imprisonment and/or fine.

title: IPC Section 324 - Voluntarily Causing Hurt by Dangerous Weapons
text: Use of dangerous weapons or means resulting in more severe punishment than Section 323.

title: IPC Section 325 - Grievous Hurt
text: Punishment for causing grievous hurt; more severe penalties than simple hurt.

title: IPC Section 376D - Gang Rape
text: Punishment for gang rape; stringent punishments including long imprisonment terms.

title: CrPC Section 154 - Information in Cognizable Cases (FIR)
text: Police must record information relating to cognizable offences and prepare an FIR; duty to register and investigate.

title: CrPC Section 156 - Police Investigation without Magistrate Order
text: Police powers to investigate cognizable offenses without prior magistrate order.

title: CrPC Section 173 - Report of Police Officer on Completion of Investigation
text: Police must submit investigation report (charge-sheet or closure report) to magistrate after investigation.

title: CrPC Section 190 - Magistrate's Power to Take Cognizance
text: Magistrate may take cognizance of offenses upon police report, information or complaint.

title: CrPC Section 200 - Examination of Complainant by Magistrate
text: Magistrate may examine complainant on oath when cognizance is taken on police report or complaint.

title: CrPC Section 167 - Procedure When Investigation Cannot be Completed in 24 Hours
text: Police custody and remand process when investigation requires detention beyond 24 hours.

title: Constitution Article 14 - Equality Before Law
text: State shall not deny any person equality before the law and equal protection of laws within Indian territory.

title: Constitution Article 19 - Freedom of Speech and Expression
text: Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, assembly, association, movement, residence and profession.

title: Constitution Article 21 - Right to Life and Personal Liberty
text: No person shall be deprived of life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.

title: Constitution Article 32 - Right to Constitutional Remedies
text: Right to move the Supreme Court for enforcement of fundamental rights by appropriate proceedings.

title: Indian Evidence Act - Overview
text: The Indian Evidence Act, 1872 governs admissibility, relevancy and proof of evidence in courts of India.

title: Motor Vehicles Act 1988 - Overview
text: Regulates motor vehicles, liability, compensation, insurance and Motor Accident Claims Tribunals (MACT).

title: Consumer Protection Act 2019 - Overview
text: Provides consumer rights, redressal mechanisms and remedies for deficiency in services, including medical negligence.

title: Hindu Adoption and Maintenance Act, 1956 - Overview
text: Law governing adoption and maintenance for Hindus, including rights and legal consequences of adoption.

title: Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 - Overview
text: Prohibits giving or taking dowry; provides penalties for violation and mechanisms to address dowry-related offences.

title: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005 - Overview
text: Civil remedies and protection orders for women subject to domestic violence; protection officers and magistrate powers.

title: POCSO Act, 2012 - Protection of Children from Sexual Offences
text: Special procedures, child-sensitive investigation, and stringent punishments for sexual offences against children.

title: The Juvenile Justice Act, 2015 - Overview
text: Care, protection and rehabilitation of children in conflict with law and those in need of care and protection.

title: IPC/Related - Practical Note on 498A
text: 498A deals with cruelty to married woman by husband/relatives; legal proceedings and safeguards exist to prevent misuse.

title: Right to Information Act, 2005 - Overview
text: Provides citizens access to information under public authorities and the process to file RTI applications.

title: Information Technology Act, 2000 - Overview
text: Governs electronic commerce, cyber offences, data protection aspects and intermediaries' liabilities.

title: Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 - Overview
text: Offences by public servants, bribery, and provisions to combat corruption in government service.

title: Hindu Marriage Act, 1955 - Overview
text: Governs marriage, divorce, matrimonial remedies for Hindus; includes grounds for divorce and maintenance.

title: Indian Succession Act - Overview
text: Rules for intestate and testamentary succession for different communities and property distribution.

title: Transfer of Property Act, 1882 - Overview
text: Governs transfer of property by act of parties including sale, mortgage, lease and gift.

title: Rent Control/Local Laws - Practical Note
text: State-level rent control statutes govern landlord-tenant relations; rules vary across states.

title: National Disaster Management Act - Overview
text: Legal framework for disaster management, compensation and relief mechanisms in India.

title: Key Labor Laws - Overview
text: Industrial Disputes Act, Factories Act, Payment of Wages, and other labor protections for workers.

title: Representation of the People Act - Overview
text: Rules relating to elections, disqualification of members, electoral offences and dispute resolution.

title: Practical Note: Filing Complaints & FIRs
text: For cognizable offences, file FIR at police station or file complaint before magistrate; retain copy of FIR for records.

title: Practical Note: Motor Accident Claims
text: Claim compensation from insurer or owner/government department via Motor Accident Claims Tribunal (MACT) or civil court.

title: Medical Negligence - Practical Remedies
text: Patients may seek remedy via consumer courts, civil suits for damages, and professional disciplinary bodies; criminal prosecution possible in grave negligence.

title: Citizenship Act, 1955 - Birth, Descent, Registration
text: Rules for acquiring citizenship by birth, descent, registration and naturalization; amendments may affect date-based rules.

title: Children's Rights & Adoption - Practical Note
text: Adopted child acquires rights similar to biological child under applicable adoption laws; juvenile laws protect children's welfare.

title: How To Claim Compensation (Practical Steps)
text: Collect evidence (FIR/First information, medical reports, photos), send notice to insurer/owner, file claim petition at tribunal/court.

title: IPC Section 375 - Rape
text: Defines rape, circumstances that constitute rape, and exceptions. Protects women from sexual assault.

title: IPC Section 376 - Punishment for Rape
text: Punishment ranges from 7 years to life imprisonment depending on the severity and circumstances.

title: IPC Section 377 - Unnatural Offences
text: Criminalizes sexual acts 'against the order of nature'; partially decriminalized by Supreme Court in 2018 for consenting adults.

title: IPC Section 354 - Assault or Criminal Force on Woman
text: Punishment for assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty.

title: IPC Section 498A - Cruelty by Husband or Relatives
text: Addresses cruelty and harassment of a woman by husband or his relatives; includes dowry-related harassment.

title: IPC Section 509 - Insult to Modesty of Woman
text: Punishment for word, gesture, or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman.

title: IPC Section 120B - Criminal Conspiracy
text: Punishment for involvement in criminal conspiracy, ranging from imprisonment to life sentence.

title: IPC Section 124A - Sedition
text: Punishment for sedition against the government; debated in modern times for free speech concerns.

title: IPC Section 420 - Cheating and Dishonestly Inducing Delivery of Property
text: Covers acts of cheating and fraud with intent to gain property.

title: IPC Section 406 - Criminal Breach of Trust
text: Punishment for misappropriation of property entrusted to someone.

title: IPC Section 409 - Criminal Breach of Trust by Public Servant
text: Specific punishment for public servants or bankers involved in breach of trust.

title: IPC Section 304B - Dowry Death
text: Defines dowry death; prescribes punishment for husband or relatives if woman dies within 7 years of marriage under unnatural circumstances.

title: IPC Section 326 - Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt by Dangerous Weapons
text: Severe punishment for causing grievous hurt with weapons or corrosive substances.

title: IPC Section 307 - Attempt to Murder
text: Punishment for attempt to commit murder; imprisonment may extend to life.

title: IPC Section 363 - Kidnapping
text: Punishment for kidnapping any person from lawful guardianship.

title: IPC Section 364A - Kidnapping for Ransom
text: Punishment includes death or life imprisonment for kidnapping with intent to demand ransom.

title: IPC Section 375A - Marital Rape (Debate)
text: Though not fully criminalized, discussions ongoing about recognizing marital rape under Indian law.

title: IPC Section 201 - Causing Disappearance of Evidence
text: Punishment for destroying or causing disappearance of evidence in criminal cases.

title: IPC Section 203 - Giving False Information
text: Punishment for providing false information to screen an offender.

title: IPC Section 211 - False Charge of Offence
text: Punishment for falsely charging someone with an offence with intent to harm.

title: IPC Section 228 - Insulting Public Servant in Judicial Proceeding
text: Punishment for intentionally insulting or interrupting a public servant during judicial proceedings.

title: IPC Section 295A - Deliberate and Malicious Acts Intended to Outrage Religious Feelings
text: Punishment for deliberate insult of religion or religious beliefs.

title: IPC Section 298 - Uttering Words to Hurt Religious Feelings
text: Punishment for words or actions deliberately intended to wound religious sentiments.

title: Constitution Article 300A - Right to Property
text: Protects citizens from deprivation of property without legal authority.

title: Constitution Article 14 - Right to Equality
text: Guarantees equality before law and equal protection of laws within India.

title: Constitution Article 19 - Right to Freedom
text: Includes freedom of speech, expression, assembly, association, movement, residence, and profession.

title: Constitution Article 21 - Right to Life and Personal Liberty
text: Ensures no person is deprived of life or personal liberty except by procedure established by law.

title: Constitution Article 32 - Right to Constitutional Remedies
text: Empowers individuals to move Supreme Court for enforcement of fundamental rights.

title: Constitution Article 226 - Power of High Courts to Issue Writs
text: Authorizes High Courts to issue writs for enforcement of rights.

title: Constitution Article 370 - Special Status of Jammu & Kashmir
text: Gave special autonomy to J&K; abrogated in 2019.

title: Citizenship Act, 1955
text: Governs acquisition, determination, and termination of Indian citizenship.

title: Indian Penal Code, 1860
text: Comprehensive criminal code defining offences and punishments in India.

title: Criminal Procedure Code, 1973
text: Prescribes procedures for investigation, trial, and punishment of offences.

title: Indian Evidence Act, 1872
text: Sets rules relating to evidence admissibility in Indian courts.

title: Hindu Marriage Act, 1955
text: Governs marriage and divorce among Hindus in India.

title: Hindu Succession Act, 1956
text: Defines inheritance and succession rights under Hindu law.

title: Payment of Wages Act, 1936
text: Regulates payment of wages to employees by employers.

title: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947
text: Provides machinery for resolution of industrial disputes.

title: Wildlife Protection Act, 1972
text: Protects wild animals, birds, and plants; creates protected areas.

title: Environment Protection Act, 1986
text: Provides for protection and improvement of environment.

title: Information Technology Act, 2000
text: Legal recognition for electronic transactions, cybercrimes, and data protection.

title: Right to Information Act, 2005
text: Empowers citizens to request information from public authorities.

title: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005
text: Provides protection to women against domestic violence.

title: Right to Education Act, 2009
text: Makes education free and compulsory for children aged 6 to 14.

title: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012
text: Strengthens legal framework for protection of children from sexual abuse.

title: Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985
text: Regulates drugs, narcotics, and their penalties for illegal possession.

title: Employees' Provident Fund Act, 1952
text: Provides retirement benefits for employees.

title: Contract Labour Regulation and Abolition Act, 1970
text: Regulates employment of contract labour.

title: Income Tax Act, 1961
text: Governs taxation of incomes in India.

title: Companies Act, 2013
text: Regulates company formation, governance, and compliance.

title: SARFAESI Act, 2002
text: Allows banks to recover loans by auctioning secured assets.

title: Consumer Protection Act, 1986
text: Protects consumer interests against unfair trade practices; replaced by 2019 Act.

title: Consumer Protection Act, 2019
text: Strengthens consumer rights, establishes consumer commissions, includes e-commerce.

title: Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002
text: Prevents money laundering and confiscates property obtained from it.

title: Juvenile Justice Act, 2015
text: Deals with juveniles in conflict with law and adoption procedures.

title: National Commission for Women Act, 1990
text: Establishes the National Commission for Women to safeguard women's rights.

title: Unorganized Workers’ Social Security Act, 2008
text: Provides social security to unorganized workers.

title: Benami Transactions Prohibition Act, 1988
text: Prohibits benami transactions where property is held in another person’s name.

title: Forest Rights Act, 2006
text: Recognizes forest dwellers’ rights to land and resources.

title: Persons with Disabilities Act, 1995
text: Provides equal opportunities and protection of rights of persons with disabilities.

title: Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016
text: Strengthens rights and entitlements of persons with disabilities.

title: Maintenance of Internal Security Act, 1971
text: Provided preventive detention during Emergency; repealed later.

title: Prevention of Terrorism Act, 2002
text: Anti-terrorism legislation, later repealed due to misuse concerns.

title: National Disaster Management Act, 2005
text: Provides for effective management of disasters.

title: Trade Marks Act, 1999
text: Provides protection and registration of trade marks.

title: Geographical Indications of Goods Act, 1999
text: Provides protection for geographical indications of goods in India.

title: Patents Act, 1970
text: Regulates patents for inventions in India.

title: Copyright Act, 1957
text: Protects literary, artistic, and musical works.

title: Indian Contract Act, 1872
text: Defines law relating to contracts in India.

title: Transfer of Property Act, 1882
text: Regulates transfer of property by act of parties.

title: Code of Civil Procedure, 1908
text: Regulates civil court procedure in India.

title: Specific Relief Act, 1963
text: Provides remedies for persons whose rights are affected.

title: Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881
text: Regulates promissory notes, bills of exchange, and cheques.

title: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act, 2005
text: Provides 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in rural India.

title: Factories Act, 1948
text: Regulates working conditions in factories.

title: Representation of the People Act, 1951
text: Deals with conduct of elections, qualifications, and disqualifications of MPs/MLAs.

title: Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996
text: Provides legal framework for arbitration in India.

title: Competition Act, 2002
text: Prevents anti-competitive practices in trade and commerce.

title: Cable Television Networks Regulation Act, 1995
text: Regulates operation of cable TV networks in India.

title: Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006
text: Consolidates food laws to ensure safe food practices.

title: Lokpal and Lokayuktas Act, 2013
text: Establishes anti-corruption ombudsman for investigation of corruption cases.

title: Essential Commodities Act, 1955
text: Controls production, supply, and distribution of essential commodities.

title: Companies Act, 1956
text: Earlier law regulating companies, replaced by Companies Act, 2013.

title: Maternity Benefit Act, 1961
text: Regulates maternity leave and benefits for women employees.

title: Payment of Gratuity Act, 1972
text: Provides gratuity to employees after minimum years of service.

title: Workmen's Compensation Act, 1923
text: Compensation for work-related injury or death of workers.

title: Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017
text: Introduces GST as indirect tax replacing multiple other taxes.

title: Securitisation and Reconstruction of Financial Assets and Enforcement of Security Interest Act, 2002
text: Empowers banks to recover non-performing assets without court intervention.

title: Law Commission of India Act, 1955
text: Provides for constitution of Law Commission for legal reforms.
